docs.snippet: Phil Jackson, the Knicks president, left Tuesday’s game with 8:54 left, after the Knicks had allowed a Lakers’ franchise-record 51 points in the third quarter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Phil Jackson, the Knicks president, left Tuesday’s game with 8:54 left, after the Knicks had allowed a Lakers’ franchise-record 51 points in the third quarter.
docs.abstract: New York Knicks president Phil Jackson leaves game early during team's devastating loss to the Los Angeles Lakers, who scored franchise-record 51 points in a single quarter; Jackson says he has not yet begun to inquire about coaches, scouts or other front office staff he might want to bring in, saying he is in assessment mode and more concerned about bringing in talent.

headline.main: Knicks Are Routed in a Display That Jackson Calls ‘Awful’
headline.print_headline: Knicks Are Routed in a Display That Jackson Calls ‘Awful’

docs.snippet: A company owned by Mikhail D. Prokhorov, the owner of the Nets, said, “This is a long process which may or may not come to fruition, and nothing is imminent.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: A company owned by Mikhail D. Prokhorov, the owner of the Nets, said, “This is a long process which may or may not come to fruition, and nothing is imminent.”
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets owner Mikhail D Prokhorov concedes that his plan to make team a Russian entity may never come to fruition, after NBA refutes claim made by Prokhorov that league had given him permission for transfer of team.

headline.main: Prokhorov Tempers Talk of Nets Becoming Russian
headline.print_headline: Prokhorov Tempers Talk of Nets Becoming Russian

docs.snippet: Calipari’s five starting freshmen, all N.B.A. prospects, flopped in the regular season, and he apologizes for that, but it is ancient history with Kentucky in the Round of 16....
docs.lead_paragraph: Calipari’s five starting freshmen, all N.B.A. prospects, flopped in the regular season, and he apologizes for that, but it is ancient history with Kentucky in the Round of 16.
docs.abstract: Bill Pennington On College Basketball holds that Kentucky men's team, featuring five NBA-prospect freshmen, has come into its own during the NCAA tournament after attracting widespread criticism during the regular season; credits coach John Calipari, who has taken personal blame for fact that players were not ready earlier.

headline.main: Don’t Blame John Calipari if Kentucky Looks Like a Winner
headline.print_headline: Ready at Just the Right Time

docs.abstract: Unlikely Brigham Young women's basketball team, which has little discernible history to speak of, prepares to face top-ranked Connecticut in round three of the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

docs.snippet: A regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Tuesday that Northwestern football players could unionize. Does that mean some players will be able to organize and get better health care and academic support? Or does it spell the e...
docs.lead_paragraph: A regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Tuesday that Northwestern football players could unionize. Does that mean some players will be able to organize and get better health care and academic support? Or does it spell the end of college sports as we know it? The AP takes a look at all sides of the issue.

headline.main: Questions, Answers About College Union Ruling
